Mar 16 2006	Great service	My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a week via a time share exchanged. We were delighted with the hotel. The rooms are smaller than most people are used to but we found them very cozy and nicely furnished. I didn't find the bathrooms small. The breakfast we had was better than the usual continental breakfast. It has several kinds of cereal, muffins, bagels, toast, danish as well as hardboiled egg, pineable, watermelon and cantalope, banana and several kinds of juice as well as coffee. More than enough to start the day. Breakfast was in their lovely restaurant, Ovations. Room service was a real bargain and the food was from the Ovations kitchen so it was very good. The front desk acknowledged the rooms were small but they said they try to make up for it with fine service and I would say they did that excactly. Guests were invited to a wine and cheese party during the week so you could chat with fellow guests and meet the management. The hotel is in a very well lite area right across from the City Hall and near the Opera, Symphony and Ballet so there is always something going on and people around. The area in the direction of Market St is not the best but the other direction toward Gough has very nice restaurants and shops. Restaurants that were recommend were Citizen Cake and Indigo. We used a 7 day pass and used it a lot for cable cars, buses & trolleys. YOu don't really need a car but the hotel has a garage if you need one. We took a Wine tour through a company called Supersightseeing and it was less crowded than a Gray Line tour that we ran into. Our tour guide (Steve) was wonderful and very knowledgeable. Good place to see on your own or walking tour is Pacific Heights with its Victorian homes and great views of the City. Stop at Union St. in Pacific Heights that has some great cafes and boutiques. We would definitely return to this hotel if we visit again.

Mar 4 2006	Nothing was too much trouble	The staff could not have been more helpful and courteous, Jose-Louis helped us no end and the other staff were most helpful and friendly. The Inn at The Opera is ideally located for walking and close to reliable public transport. Don't take the cable cars if you are in a hurry, the car operators certainly aren't!

Feb 5 2006	Charming small hotel	My husband and I booked this hotel based on it's location and positive reviews. We stayed one night and attended the SF Ballet's "Swan Lake". The ballet was beautiful and the hotel was only a short walk away. The staff is friendly but the rooms are extremely small. I would estimate about 200 sq feet. Our room on the 4th floor had a window that looked out to the alley but it was nice that we could open it for fresh air because it was unseasonably warm. The bed was comfortable but unfortunately we did not discover the ear plugs in the drawer of the nightstand until the next morning. We were awoken at 1:30am by an extremely loud garbage truck in the alley emptying the garbage bins and found it difficult to sleep due to the noise for most of the night. The bathroom was so small it was difficult to find space to put out toiletries but the shower did have adequate pressure. The complimentary breakfast in the morning is continental style, with very few choices. It is rather strange that the waiters hand out tip portfolios at breakfast, but since they were nice enough to refill our coffee cups for us we left them a few dollars. The parking package we booked via the internet was $142/night. Although the hotel was adequate, we felt the accommodations were simply too small to be comfortable. Next time we visit SF we will seek a hotel with larger rooms, even if the location is not as convenient. We enjoyed a nice dinner at the Hayes Street Grill but be sure to book advance reservations on performance nights because it gets very crowded. I would recommend any of the grilled fish, the french fries and of course the wondeful creme brulee! As with most restaurants in the area, it is expensive but the service was absolutely wonderful which is made it a lovely meal.

Nov 10 2005	Think small	How you perceive the inn will depend much, I think, on the package you can arrange on the hotel's own website. Having stayed at this property during ten different occasions, I hope to provide some insight.We almost always book a room with parking included. Since parking rates are now $25 a night plus 14% tax, you should do what you can to snare this arrangement. Since so many guests do not seem to mind the small rooms, there should be no problems unless you have large suitcases. Each room is equipped with a kitchenette (microwave, small fridge, enough utensils to reheat food)and two packets of coffee, which will be replaced at $1.75 each. This policy has been in force for four or five years. Yes, it should be replaced daily, for free.The service at the desk is very accommodating, and, if things don't work properly in the room, you can count on the help to fix things. Your room is likely to be assigned randomly, even if you request specific rooms. Often the inn is fully booked with performers and/or their guests and the management cannot always guarantee your requests. You should, however, ask to be in a room that is not adjacent to a room with jacuzzi tub, as the noise from the bath in the suite will make sleeping difficult. Street-side rooms have nice neighborhood views but can be noisy if you choose to leave your window(s) open. And since there is no air-conditioning, you will certainly need to do so during the occasional hot days.A complimentary continental breakfast is included(not too inspiring but there is fresh fruit and unlimited drinks), and yes, a folder is presented upon departure. For heaven's sakes, put in a dollar or two. Many other establishments do the same. We've eaten a couple of times at the opulent restaurant Ovation, located past the front desk. Although there is enough choice on the menu, prices have escalated seriously enough and service has grown indifferent at best, to the point where we can no longer recommend it. Try instead Absinthe, Jardinire, Hayes Street Grill, or, for the super budgeters, Stelline's.

Oct 9 2005	None better	My famliy stayed at the Inn on the 2nd and 3rd of Oct. When we pulled up to the curb my wife recieved a call that her mother(85)had been rushed to the hospital in Spokane, Washington and did not look good. This was at 10:00am Sunday morning. Not only did the hotel let us check in early, the staff looked into booking my wife on a plane to Spokane. As my mother in laws condition improved over the next few hours so we decided to stay. We were in room 64, a suite, that was absolutly delightful. A sitting/kitchen area, living room / 2nd bedroom, full size main bedroom, and two full size bathrooms. The staff was nothing but excellent in every instance and we WILL return for accomadations when we plan to vacation in the Bay area.

Oct 4 2005	Why so few reviews of this Hotel?	I can't understand why there are so few reviews of The Inn at the Opera. We, (2 couples), found it excellent. We booked through Expedia and got excellent rooms for about 55/$96.Some reviewers have said the rooms were small, but that is only by US motel standards, by Europen standards they were a good size.The staff were efficient, courteous and friendly, the rooms were spotless. and towels seemed to be changed as soon as you wetted them!Continental breakfast is extensive, delicious and best of all, complementary!OK, it isn't on Fisherman's Wharf, or Union Square, but that is reflected in the price, and many people (us included), regard that as a plus point, not a minus.You can walk to Market Street and the cable car in 15 mins, and a cab (between 4 people) was only $8 to anywhere in the centre, so you are not out in the back of beyond. Check out any other hotels in town at a similar price, and this has to be the one to choose - highly recommended.

Feb 8 2005	Old-fashioned attention	Great location, friendly and extremely courteous staff, reasonable prices. A little piece of European boutique hotel elegance in San Francisco. Near great shops and interesting eateries. Plan to stay there again next month (March 2005).

I have to tell you this however petty it may sound as I find a charge of $3.50 unjust. My complaint is the coffee packets left in the room. The hotel told me that it was full but that it would find a room for me as the reservation mistake was its fault. When I arrived I found that the hotel itself is located essentially behind city hall, which puts it in walking distance of government buildings in the Civic Center. However, the street has no other businesses on it (it all appeared to be older apartment buildings with metal security gates), and at night it was dark so the walk to the few restaurants on Van Ness (California Pizza Kitchen, Chevy's, a noodle place, and McDonald's) did not seem like a good idea. The hotel itself is rather small. The lobby consists of a small sitting area and then the front desk. The elevator is an ancient contraption that claims to fit six persons. Classical music is played in the hotel, including in the elevator. I was assigned room 68 on the 6th floor overlooking the street. It was furnished with antique-looking furniture, including an amoire and a desk. It also had a sink, microwave and undercounter refrigerator. The bathroom was tiled, had a tub/shower combination, thick towels, and nicer toiletries. Everything in the room appeared to be generally tasteful and in good condition. Other than the fact that the hotel is older and noise travels through the walls just as it would in an older home, the only drawback to the room was its small size. There was literally about one foot of space between the end of the bed and the front of the amoire.The staff was very pleasant both at check-in and check-out.All in all, the Inn at the Opera is a small, kind of creaky hotel, with small, nicely furnished rooms, on a street that does not lend itself to walking at night, and has a very nice staff. I would stay there again.

Sep 9 2004	Perfect Accomodations!	I wanted to give my nieces and their moms (my sisters) a treat for their birthdays. Oct 29 2009 	Nous avons fait un excellent choix!

Great Union Square Location Exceptional Service	Very clean, great service and location. Close to the cable car turnabout and shops. Nov 19 2009 	Excellent quality everything you expect of a JW	Stayed here in September on a weekend away. Weekends in downtown San Francisco are curious - hordes of tourists from all over the world give downtown give a somewhat theme park feel to the city. The absence of locals detracts from the experience, but that being said, the JW Marriott is exceptionally well located right near Union Square, and not too far from the BART/MUNI on Market.I arrived to SFO, and walked to the JW from Powell Station. Don't let anyone tell you that you have to take a cab to/from SFO or Oakland airport. Unless you have industrial sized luggage, take BART from the airport.Arriving early in the morning, I tried for an early check-in, but the room wasn't ready. This isn't a huge gripe except Marriott has an option for early check in - subject to availability. I wish they would simply remove this option since there's really only downside for the hotel. It creates an expectation for the traveller and makes the hotel say 'no' to something on first impression. Notwithstanding, they were very gracious to take our bags and we went sightseeing in the meantime.The room was exceptional. Sometimes the Marriott interiors are so generic it's impossible to tell whether you are in Bangkok, Boston, or Bangalore. This is different - great pictures with SF themes and a true luxury edge to the room made this very special.Service was very good - I ordered a wine and cheese platter which came promptly as promised. The cheeses were excellent quality, Stilton, Camembert and Jarlsberg and beautifully presented. I travel a lot and it's clear they pride themselves on going the extra mile here.Downsides: I don't blame the specific hotel for the early check-in disappointment, but Marriott really does need to give better guidance as to how likely it is. The only other problem was all elevators were not fully functional which led to some delays lining up for the elevator, but this was minor.Upshot is: An excellent quality five star hotel which meets all expectations. I do recommend travelers to SF venture farther afield than downtown and explore places like the Mission, Haight, and Castro to get more of a real SF flavor.

Nov 17 2009 	Great city great hotel	I've stayed at many Marriott locations around the world and this was my first time staying at a JW Marriott. The hotel is beautiful. Nov 11 2009	Wedding weekend	We were staying at the JW Marriott for a long weekend in which a family member was getting married. We had an easy check in and the front desk staff was very accomodating. The bathroom was lovely and updated with granite counters and separate shower and tub. The beds were comfy and the TV had a good selection of channels. The ballroom is gorgeous and the food was amazing! I am used to a lot of food being served at the cocktail hour but the wedding planner said they only order one passed item per person (So if you have 4 passed items, you are alloted only 4 pieces of food)...needless to say, we were ready to eat our dinner! It was a fantastic wedding and the bride and groom seemed so happy with everything!Parking was tremendously expensive...$40 per night. And as with most hotels, there were a lot of hidden charges. Nov 10 2009 	This is a JW Marriott?	The hotel is located in an ideal location, adjacent to Union Square - and has an impressive atrium-style lobby with elevators that soar above you into the floors above. That was the high point - and our first impressions were quickly extinguished by several cleanliness and service issues throughout our stay. Even more importantly, the high-rise hotel abounds with hazards to young children with some windows that are too easily opened by curious toddlers. In my in-laws' room, the casement windows could be opened entirely - without any stops or locks of any kind. It was frightening and shocking that a hotel of this stature would allow such a hazard to go unmitigated (Room 1109). Our room, 1111, had windows that were easily opened by youngsters - but had stops on them. Still, the window opened widely enough so that a small child might be able to slip their legs through - so we were still quite jittery about ever allowing our daughter to get too near them.The cleanliness of the hotel was also a big problem. On arriving to our room, and using the toilet for the first time, I noticed some "resi-doo" under the seat that I had just lifted. Disgusting. Also, the glass shelves adjacent to the sink looked like they had not been cleaned in weeks. The brown-colored granite may have been nice when the hotel was new - but coupled with my toilet discovery, dirty shelves and dim lighting - I got the creeps.Once in the shower, the water pressure was SEVERELY lacking. And I know everyone is trying to save water, but why do we need to be subjected to water flow that more closely resembles an eye-dropper? The gym contains some unusual and awkward equipment is kind of dirty. Definitely not a fitness "club" - but a smallish room packed with mostly treadmills, elliptical machines, etc. Go someplace else - this hotel looks like a Marriott on the surface, but operates more like a Holiday Inn. There are way too many options in SF than to pay full fare for ecomomy class.

Aug 10 2009 	Location location location...and the hotel's not bad either! Jun 18 2009 	Nice hotel for business trip	My husband and I stayed here for a night in December when he had a business trip of SF. May 27 2009 	Awesome Hotel Great Location a San Francisco gem at Union Square	This hotel has great amenities...great location... and generally excellent service. May 22 2009 	Courtyard By Marriott on Steroids	This hotel must be going bankrupt based on staff comments - I arrived late in the evening (around 10:30pm) but figured a JW Marriott would have room service to get a light dinner. May 9 2009	Nice place to stay	Great for a weekend away - very convenient to public transport and SFO sites and attractions. Room was comfortable and clean.

May 4 2009 	Solid hotel with a great location	I have made two different trips to this hotel in the past month. The rooms are clean and well-furnished. Mar 30 2009 	Great location decent rooms average service	We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August 08 during our first leg of CA trip holiday. Mar 26 2009	Not up to JW Marriott international hotel standard	This hotel was a disappointment. Mar 21 2009 	Great location but not perfect hotel	Stayed here for a week after Xmas on Marriott points. Atrium style hotel with rooms circling lobby/bar/reception area. Also expected small tv in bathroom - thought I read this in a review but not there. Entrance to lifts weren't in view of reception staff and lifts weren't manned so anyone could walk in off street and get into lifts and potentially up to rooms. Handy for cable car. Easy walk to Market St for tram. A few doors from a great little theatre -Post St where we were able to see Dame Edna.Only had happy hour cocktail in bar as quite expensive. Our safe didn't work on arrival and we reported this but when we came back from a walk it was still unfixed - this was a pain as we were having to carry all our credit cards and passports. Eventually we got sorted - very slowly. I ended up waiting behind reception while someone tried to find safe keys and worked out how to work it. Mar 16 2009 	Great Stay	This was a great hotel in a wonderful location in Union Square. Hotel was very elegant and clean. Rooms were large with very big bathrooms. Mar 6 2009 	Good hotel too expensive not for families though.	I was traveling on business to California so my wife and 9 month old son were traveling along. The food was average to good, if you got what you ordered, but way overpriced - I don't care if I am in California or not. There are several good local restaurants nearby though.The beds are extremely soft. The rooms are quiet. The bell staff is very friendly and prompt with service. There is no pool at this hotel. There is also no place, other than your room, that is good to sit with children. The lobby is really cool to look at but not child/baby proof. You can only valet park at this hotel so get ready to get your wallet out because it is very expensive, near $50/day, plus tips for the guys. The neighborhood is definitely fine during the day. At night we were still comfortable out on the street but only because there were other people around. You will walk by homeless or beggers in this location. It also seemed there is a rather unsavory neighborhood not too far away in one direction. I would not have wandered too far at night, particularly because we had our baby with us. Overall this hotel would be great if you are traveling alone or with a girlfriend/boyfirend or spouse. It is chic. This hotel is not good for families, particularly families with young children. We would come back but not with children.

Feb 25 2009 	Fantastic Bed Nice Rooms lots of outside noise	Stayed here during a weekend in January for my wife's birthday. The hotel is a nice property but nowhere near some of the other JW Marriotts that I have stayed at but I think that has to do with those have been newly built while this one was taken over. Feb 23 2009 	Slightly diasppointed - there are better options out there	I usally travel to San Francisco a few times a year and usually stay at the Marriott or Westin. Since my company has preferred rates with Marriott, I thought I would try the JW on my latest trip, and despite the location near Union Square (which couldn't be beat), I have to admit that I was slightly disappointed.My trip started off badly and I had to wait nearly a half hour at reception while my reservation was "found" - - this was despite the copy of my travel itinerary and confirmation number that I provided. Not exactly the way you want to be greeted after a cross country flight, but could deal with that.Overall, I found the room to be very similar to other Marriotts across the country although the bathroom was a little nicer - surprising given the premium marque.However, my biggest complaint was due to the room that was ultimately found for me and which was adjacent to the fitness center. Jan 4 2009 	Bed so comfy!	I am writing this review from the hotel bed. It is so comfortable, I can't bring myself to get out of it! The hotel room is large also. Dec 18 2008 	My favorite SanFran Hotel	I have been traveling to San Francisco extensively over the past two years, and always try to book the JW. Nov 30 2008 	Not bad at all	Better than expected. Oct 19 2008 	Pleasantly surprised	I usually prefer to stay in smaller boutique hotels, however we booked at the Marriott since we had a gift certificate to put towards our room. But, there are some great advantages to staying at a larger hotel like this. First, our room was huge compared to other city hotels I've stayed in. Oct 12 2008 	Great end to our holiday at the JW Marriott SF	I stayed at the JW Marriott at the end of a holiday driving around California. I'm a Marriott Platinum member (i.e. I stay in Marriotts 100+ nights a year) so my treatment might not be typical for all guests.First impressions were 'hmm' - the hotel looks very nice, but, strangely the lobby was on the third floor, with the entrance on the first floor. As we were driving there we were also a bit stuck as the hotel's driving entrance is actually on Mason street, and due to SF's one way system this wasn't so easy to get back onto, so, if arriving by car try and get onto Mason/Post. Parking is expensive in San Francisco in general, you are better not bringing the car if you can avoid as you certainly dont need it in the city. There is a Hertz location in the hotel, and there is also one on Mason street that is less than a block away as well.However, arrival was great, the hotel lobby is lovely, and the roof actually opens up all the way to the top of the hotel (21 floors). The elevators also look out on the same view, so it can be really nice to be travelling up to your room if you're on a high floor (or to the bar/rest area on the 21st floor).Got to our room on the 18th floor, it was nicely big, and had a nice view in that we could just see the bay and it is always nice to be high up. (See the photos on this review to see the view we had). The bed was a typical Marriott one (i.e. lovely and relaxing), the bathroom was very well presented with marble, bath robes provided (nb: one under the bathroom sink for some reason, the other in the wardrobe as usual) and a lovely shower. My wife also enjoyed the bath. The TV was also very nice - a huge 42" High def affair, with a lot of channels choice. As a nice touch the room also had a 'valet call' button - so you could press it and the valet would come to your room, a nice touch (a little like the 'butler bell call' in old style houses in England). The room also had an ipod base to play music around your room (didn't have one to know how well it works)We also had access to the club lounge, on the 21st floor, for breakfast and nibbles. It was quite busy, but, had amazing views of the city, a very comprehensive breakfast (more like an American breakfast than a continental one), and they'd even lend you a DVD player if you wanted.Service from the staff was great, and they even allowed us to check out late as our flight was in the evening. Everyone was very polite and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - just a shame that it was only for a single night.Final point on location - though the hotel claims to be on Union square it is actually a block away... doesn't make any difference, but, a minor point. But, otherwise the hotel is in a great location - excellent shopping within a few blocks, the same with the cable cars. The area was also very safe late at night with lots of traffic and light in our view.We stayed at both this and the San Francisco Marriott on our trip, and this one is definately nicer, so, if we were coming back to San Francisco we'd try to stay here if possible (Bear in mind I'm loyal to Marriotts!)

Sep 2 2008 	Nice Hotel Good Location	I would recommend the JW Marriott in San Francisco for any stay. My wife and I stayed there for a anniversary and received great service. Aug 25 2008 	Good hotel in SF	The staff at the hotel were really helpful and listened to our requests. The suite was nicely decorated and very comfortable. There were a few issues however they were resolved very quickly.Only issue they couldn't resolve was some noise from the disco.

Aug 24 2008	Nice digs just no 'special' vibe	I have nothing to complain about except I wanted more 'glamour' for my families' vacation. Aug 20 2008 	Great Hotel Located Conveniently in Union Square	We booked the JW using points and wanted to stay in downtown SFO in a location convenient to the many attractions. We had a rental car for one of the days in the hotel, but not the other two.First, if you have a car, parking is expensive - upwards of $50/night. There's no self park unless you want to drive around looking for a public garage, which I would not recommend.As with any JW, service is fantastic. Our room was lower and was next to a business office. We could see people in each window working at their desks - and I'm sure they could see us.Room is quiet at night except for the occasional siren from the street (police, fire). The room is on the smallish side, but not terribly small. Bathroom is updated and new (clean!). There's a tub with jets in it along with a small shower stall. The showerhead was low enough so it was below my nose and the stall was small enough so my elbows hit the wall when I turned (I'm 6'1).The other odd thing is that the bathroom has no locking door - just a sliding door. So if you're with a family, people are apt to walk into the bathroom when it's being used.Beds are comfortable. There's a mini bar that senses when you take something out and charges you. You have like 10 seconds to look at something before it charges you. We asked for a fridge and promptly brought it up and set it up. That worked well as we were able to buy some drinks and keep them in the room.As with a JW, everything is expensive, including room service, mini bar, etc. Be prepared to tip people.The location is fantastic. A short walk from the hotel is Union Square with a mall, including Macy's. It's also the terminus of a cable car route. We were going to take a cab to the airport at the end of our stay, but it turned out that they have a limo that costs the same as the cab (about $45 + tip). It was a nice end to the vacation.I would recommend the JW as a place to stay that's very nice and away from the tourist areas - but also a place where you can get to the tourist areas without much trouble.

Aug 14 2008 	A gem in the city	This hotel was beautiful and centrally located a block from Union Square. Jul 22 2008 	Good Location Fair Price	Recently stayed at the JW Marriott in SF. San Francisco is a great trip if you're looking for a long weekend vacation. Space is pricey, so the rooms were nice, but small. Large flat screen tv was a plus, but for a JW, the luxury was minimized a bit by the space. Also, the bathroom was fairly large, but felt very dated.Service is great though, with an in room butler button for your use. A few times I requested towels and other items, and a person came to our door in less than 5 minutes. As for the hotel itself, the restaurant and bar was undergoing construction which is scheduled to be done later this summer. Should be pretty nice as it'll be brand new. Hotel location was ok, union square doesnt have much 'sites' but a good shopping and walking area. Trolley cars and bus lines are just 2 blocks over, and the neighborhood is also walking distance to Chinatown, Nob Hill, the Financial area and a large mall as well. - As for attractions, make sure you hit the regular spots, nothing wrong with being touristy. I recommend: Chinatown is great for dinner (better dinner than breakfast to be found there) and the old fashioned bakeries are great. The Golden Gate Bakery has the best fresh egg custards. Alcatraz tour is pretty interesting, and you can purchase tickets in advance on the internet which gets you on the shorter "will call" line. For baseball fans, catch a Giants game. Even if the teams are just ok, tickets can be had cheap and you'll definitely appreciate the park. The food options are ridiculously great.

Jul 11 2008 	Great but "not Wow"	So I probably one of the few that am not giving this hotel 4 stars. Check in once we found it was quick and pleasant. We had a very well appointed room on the 16th floor, the bathroom was probably the nicest area in the room. I have seen Renaissance hotels (another Marriott line) and other JW's with nicer rooms; the look was fresh and modern but some of the furnishings looked a little too well used. Checkout was slow because the checkout through the in-room TV did not work and there was a lengthy line at the front desk downstairs. The concierge lounge breakfast was almost top notch and the concierge recommendations on area restaurants were most welcome. They continually advised us to avoid walking in the neighborhod late at night... for a reason I never understood. The neighborhood seemed fine to us with lots of people out, even after 12 midnight on a week night.

Jul 2 2008 	extremely nice	We stayed here while in town for a friend's wedding. Jun 24 2008 	Best Marriott in San Francisco	I arrived in San Francisco via the Amtrak Thruway Bus from the Emeryville train station. I arrived early but the friendly front desk person was able to find me a room on the ninth floor. Check in was smooth and fast. There was a makeshift lobby on the ground floor because the main lobby on the 2nd floor was being remodeled and was scheduled to open sometime that week.My room was good size by San Francisco standards. The rooms had recently remodeld so there was none of the decor and furnishing from the properties previous version, the Pan Pacific. My room was clean. I was a bit concerned about hearing street noise on the 9th floor but the street noise did not bother during my entire stay. Besides a desk and chair in the room there was a flat screen t.v. and chair and ottoman. The t.v. featured many cable channels. There are no ice machines on the floor so you press a conciere button for them to bring up the ice. There were two complimentary bottles of water which were replenished each day. Their a good size closet on the on other side of the wall from the sleeping area with safe in the closelet. I really like properties that offer safes in their rooms. Also a bathroom that features marble and granite and also features both a separate shower and tub. The room was cleaned well each day. the water pressure and temprature were fine. The king size bed was comfortable.I was attending the Human Resources Planning Society workshop on Succession Management and Leadership Development at this property. Continental breakfasts and lunches served during the workshop were good. The conference room was long and narrow a bit of odd shapefor a workshop. The HRPS workshop had both hits and misses. I'll look foward to their Fall Executive Forum in October at the Renaissance in downtown Chicago. I ate breakfast one day in the temporary dining room in the basement. Excellent service there and very good food. For they buffet they will even prepare you pancakes, waffles and/or omellets. The pancake as well other breakfast items were fine.One of better Marriott buffets with superb service!All of the folks I came into contact were very good. The door men and bellhops were all friendly and attentive. I even was able to use to the house Lincoln towncar. I used the gym on three occasions.Just down the street west on 700 Post st. is a very good Indonesian restaurant called Boroudur. Attended by many Indonesians. In particular I can recommend Sorabol Korean BBQ & Asian Noodles. Also good is Tom's cookies in the food circusOn one evening, some of us went to Alcaratz for the night tour. You get a wondeful view of the city but the place is a bit depressing.I can highly recommend the J.W. Marriott property in San Francisco as one of the bettter places to stay. I received both a special group rate and the HRPS rate as well! I'll stay here again!

Mar 31 2008	Beautiful	The room was huge! The linens were luscious; I loved being in the ultra soft pillow bed with comforter and pillows around me. Mar 25 2008 	JW Marriott is First Class	The location of the JW Marriott is ideal! Mar 24 2008 	Fabulous Experience!	Stayed at the Marriott for a conference and would definitely stay again. Jan 18 2008 	Beautiful hotel in a top location!	We visit San Francisco at least once a year, but twice last year. For the first time we stayed at this hotel. We had been staying at the Donatello, across the street, but a price comparison indicated that the Marriott rooms were less than the Donatello's patio rooms. Thus we elected this J.W. Marriott.We admired the hotel when it was the Pan Pacific. It's windows and architecture are unique. The open atrium remains stunning. The street entry is nicely protected from weather. We found the personnel at the entry very helpful and accommodating and they stored my golf clubs without hesitation, retrieving them at my request and without delay. They made arrangements for a limo to SFO upon our departure and it was ready and waiting right on time. We asked for a high room and received one. We looked at one of the redecorated rooms on the west perimeter of the structure and found it extraordinary, though it was not then available to us. Renovation continued on the top floors.Our room view was onto Mason. It was very nice and quite clean. We guessed, but do not know, that many of the oriental housekeeping staff were retained when the hotel changed hands. They are top notch! The furnishings, though certainly not new, were in good condition and clean. All furnishings worked well. We requested an additional luggage rack and it arrived almost immediately. As we do not dine in our rooms, we cannot otherwise comment on room service, but when we left the hotel in the mornings, generally early, we simply spotted one of the housekeeping ladies nearby and asked for a cleaning. We never failed to find a cleaned room upon our return. We also found the front desk personnel to be very friendly and helpful. We tend to make our reservation many months in advance, with any requests for special services, so we weren't surprising anyone on the spur of the moment. We were treated well.We ate one supper in the hotel restaurant. It was not particularly remarkable, but, considering the available restaurants within walking distance of the front doors of the hotel, that is not surprising. The lobby bar stays open late and many visitors used it. We enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel and have read reviews here which lament the loss of the ambiance when it was the Pan Pacific. We can appreciate that view, but what remains is still an extraordinary hotel in a wonderful location. At these prices for rooms, one has many selections throughout the city, but very few that combine the J.W.Marriott's location, ambiance, cleanliness, service and amenities. We are returning to the San Francisco J.W. Marriott in July of this year, so we'll review our assessment after our second stay. At this point, we have little doubt that it will be just as enjoyable and we will share our pictures thereafter.

Dec 14 2007 	Loved the JW Marriott!	We spent 4 days over the Thanksgiving holiday in San Francisco at the JW Marriott. I had called the hotel and requested renovated rooms on a higher floor in the back (after having read various reviews of it being noisy with sirens, etc.), but I never asked for early check-in, but I did mentioned we were flying in on a red-eye. I never expected that either room would be available at that time, but our friends room was, so we could freshen up and leave our luggage there with our connecting room ready by 11 am.The rooms are elegant and beautifully decorated with the classic "wish I had it at home" Marriott bed and bedding. Large flat screen TV, many amenities and one of the most beautiful bathrooms I've ever seen in any hotel. We were on the 14th floor and we never heard any sounds of sirens, etc. and the rooms were extremely quiet and immaculate.But even with all this elegance we agreed the best part of the JW Marriott was the staff, from the bellmen to the front desk, concierge, restaurant, bar, housekeeping and valets and every person we met. They smiled, were genuinely friendly and always greeted us, gave some excellent advice on where to eat, made reservations, etc., etc. In Hawaii we speak often of Aloha spirit and it actually is a lovely thing, but we all agreed that we had found real Aloha spirit at the JW Marriott on this trip. Interestingly, many people here told me I would be disappointed in San Francisco as it was dirty, lots of druggies and homeless (I had lived in Palo Alto for 5 years and spent a great deal of time up in the city). I am not sure where these people were, because we all found it super clean, with friendly people, streets very clean and even the homeless we did see were neatly dressed and did not hassle us and we walked everywhere with no problems. Would we go back again - in a millisecond! It's a wonderful hotel with a great staff in an ideal location in one of the most beautiful cities in the world. JW Marriott San Francisco thank you for an unforgettable vacation. And as soon as we can get both airline reservations and hotel we'll be booking again, except for a longer time.

One problem I encountered was in the morning when I wanted to take a shower there would be no hot water. I ended up having to take a bath that I was not happy with. I have had the same problem with not having hot water in the morning at other hotels. I got over it. The staff was great at the hotel. We never had to open a door. The bar had great drinks. We enjoyed drinking at the hotel bar better than anywhere else. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown. This was a great location. We did not need a car to get anywhere. I would recommend the JW Marriott to anyone. My husband and I will be returning to SF in 2010 and we definitely will be staying at the JW Marriott.

Nov 23 2007 	Great Hotel	On the final night of our tour of CA, we stayed at the JW in SF. We had asked for a high floor because of other reviews regarding remodeling. Oct 30 2007	Wonderful hotel!	I stayed here for a big conference on 10/26- 10/29 and was very impressed with the hotel. I paid $239 for a king bed through the conference. I will now review by category.Hotel: For those that don't know, this used to be the Pan Pacific hotel. I have never stayed in this hotel and don't know what to expect from the other rooms, but I was really happy with it. The bathroom was nice but only offered a shower. The bed was wonderful and had a down pillow top thingy over the mattress that made it wonderful. It had a big plasma TV and desk with a very very comfortable chair. I sat in that chair all the time. My room had two closes and a bar area as well. There looked to be a place for a fridge, but no fridge was found. Service: Very nice. I was there for 4 days and only opened the front door of the hotel a couple of times. There were always people there to do it and call a cab as well. The butler service was interesting and I only used it for a bucket of ice. There was nightly turn down service that would also fill up the ice bucket. My only complaint was that there were only 4 elevators in the whole hotel and sometimes required a short wait. All in all, it was a wonderful stay. Would definately return in the future.

Sep 5 2007 	Great 4-Star Luxury Hotel	I stayed two nights in August, 2007 at this hotel. I was very pleased with everything. ROOM: I was assigned one of the renovated rooms and it was beautiful, quiet, comfortable, spacious, and had lots of ammenities like separate shower and tub, electronic laptop safe, large functional desk, and large flat screen TV. The bed was outstanding as were the linens, pillows, and duvet. SERVICE: Service was excellent throughout my stay. There is a button on the wall in your room that you can push for just about any request. Someone appears at your door in a few moments - - service was efficient and fast. Every staff member I encountered was very polite and helpful. FITNESS: The hotel has a very nice fitness center with great equipment. CONCIERGE LOUNGE: The concierge lounge provides an excellent extended continental breakfast. TIP: the lounge gets crowded so I recommend you show up for breakfast early.LOCATION: The location is great - - right off Union Square behind the Westin St. Francis.RENOVATIONS: Although this hotel is going through a total renovation, you hardly notice it. I was impressed with how quiet the workers were. They hardly made any noise and certainly had no effect on my enjoyable stay. They are closing one floor at a time for renovations starting at the top and working down. I think the top 5 or 6 floors are done. The lobby is scheduled for renovation beginning in November. VALUE: This is not the most luxe, beautiful, or celebrated hotel in S.F. but it's an excellent choice and an excellent value when you consider that its rates are 1/2 or less than those at some of the 5-Star luxury hotels nearby. Jul 27 2007 	Great time at a great hotel in a great location with comfy beds!	My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott for 4 nights. Our room was on the 8th floor (813) and our window was overlooking Post Street. It can be quite noisy from the traffic (especially for us since we are from the desert and never hear traffic ever). The noise usually dies down around 10pm (later on the weekends) and then starts back up again arond 5am. If you aren't used to the noise, you may want to ask for a room on a higher floor or a room that is not located directly on Post Street. Jul 24 2007 	Relaxing stay!	Just had a fantastic 9 nights at the JW Marriott in SFO. As mentioned in other people's reviews of this hotel, the bathroom is a little dated and a bit too gaudy for early in the morning, but everything worked and supplies were stocked daily. It was nice to have a cup of freshly brewed coffee from the machine supplied. It is expensive at nearly $13 per night, but at least this does include unlimited local and long distance US calls which is a nice touch (no more $5 charge to phone for take out!).

Jul 17 2007 	JW Marriott - Nice but not perfect	Just returned from 5 night stay at the JW near Union Square. Jul 16 2007 	Best hotel in San Francisco	Every aspect of our stay was nothing short of perfect. If I could give six stars I would . And if it wasn't perfect to begin with it was fixed immediately. He had the kitchen prepare special chicken nuggets for him. (We have NEVER had any hotel or dining place go to the effort of creativity.) Our little guy thought the Disney on demand (little Einstein's and Mickey mouse) in the room was terrific and didn't want to go home. In fact, it was heard to tear him from the room watching the traffic and Union Square from the window so we will definitely be back. Mar 5 2007	Comfort In The City By The Bay	It is easy to leave one's heart in San Francisco, especially if you book a room at the JWM at current rates.First, the location is ideal. One can easily take the Bay Area Rapid Transport ("BART") from SFO for $5.15 and arrive at the Powell Street station, emerging from the subway right smack dab in the thick of the The City where Powell meets Market Street. Roll with the good times up hill a few blocks past Union Square to the JWM and check in with a friendly desk clerk at the third floor lobby, which is a bit dark but serene.One of four glass enclosed elevators will come quickly to fetch you from the lobby and take you up to one of 22 or so floors, down a hall that is light and airy, to a room that is clean, bright, comfortable and well appointed. The room features a king bed with soft sheets and a fantastic assortment of pillows, from soft to firm, short to long, down-filled to polyester; I counted at least six. I was impressed, particularly since hotels far too often overlook or skimp on this essential ingredient for a good night's rest.The room has a good working thermostat, wet bar, small fridge, Bose clock-radio (but alas no CD player), coffee maker, flat screen television (but alas a small one), and cotton robes (but alas no slippers). The carpet looks good and crown molding adds a nice touch, but some of the furniture is dated. The window treatments were effective and the windows actually open, but they are not double-paned or noise proof. The bathroom is well laid out with attractive fixtures, mirrors and marble. There is a separate glass shower, a full length tub, myriad toiletries, and plenty of towels.Maid service in the morning and turn-down in the evening were exceptional. On the topic of service, the JWM folks I met were friendly and response time for ice from room service (since there are no ice making machines) was stellar.There is an adequate gym for working out on the 5th Floor with televisions, complimentary towels, water bottles and apples. There is no sauna, jacuzzi or pool (got to go to the Ritz Carlton or the Nikko for those features).Following the major redo of this property which I am told is underway, I would expect room rates to rise as well. For now, at about $190 per room (for the 360 square foot version), a few nights here will, along with all the other great sights, sounds, and tastes of The City, go a long way towards stealing your heart....

Mar 5 2007 	Pink marble everywhere!	My overwhelming memory of this hotel are the bathrooms which are really so naff they should be granted some sort of historical preservation order. Pink marble, gaudy fittings - incredible. The problem is you keep spotting the same pink marble elsewhere in the hotel and this leaves you deeply traumatised. The good news is the hotel is about to have a 36m dollar makeover - hopefully the bathrooms are top priority. Pink marble aside it's a nice place if a bit dated. The big, open lobby is intimate enough to enjoy pre dinner drinks. Breakfast service is friendly and efficient as is the valet parking. The central location, just by Union Sq. makeS this an ideal place to stay to enjoy Downtown and restaurants but just be careful not to wander into Tenderloin which is very nearby - we did and felt threatened and vulnerable ( we were jostled and called white trash).

Mar 3 2007	Great location	We stayed at the JW for two nights last week and enjoyed the Union Square location. The hotel lobby is attractive with a nice restaurantfor breakfast with a good buffet. The rooms are abit dated, but comfortable. We had a kingsize with city view, the bathroom was spacious and modern. They didn't restock our mini bar or our toiletries without us calling, but you do have a personal butler available. Hertz rental is available within the hotel. We rented a car and drove an hour or so into Napa Valley, Sonoma and on to Carmel during our week in California.

Feb 5 2007	A Perfect Stay	My boyfried and I stayed here this past weekend for a long weekend away from the cold of NYC. We had a fabulous stay. The room was quite spacious given the price of the room and the service was excellent. The morning Concierge (Andrea) was wonderful and planned a trip that was amazing for us. I would stay away from the evening Concierge (Kyle? I think) b/c he really didn't listen to what we were looking for but Andrea rocked! The only thing I found unnerving was the fact that there are mirrors EVERYWHERE in the bathroom - you could watch yourself showering, taking a bath, brushing one's teeth and other unmentionable acts. Losing a few mirrors would be helpful. But that's a minor issue. I am extremely picky and was pleasantly surprised at this place - especially after reading a comment below that said it looks "dated" to "worn." If you want something modern and new then go spend the money at the St. Regis or Hotel Palomar. You definitely get what you pay for here: a comfortable bed, great service, and a positive stay.

Jan 29 2007 	Loved It !	Am a local, but we wanted to spend the night in the city. This hotel has excellent service. Everyone was wonderful and very helpful. The rooms were awesome. Jan 28 2007 	Nice hotel but bathroom although gorgeous could use improvement	The hotel service was excellent, and no complaints. The rooms were large and comfortable, and the robes were plush. The bathroom, although gorgeous, were problematic. I am fairly short (5' 2") and most of the counter space was a backsplash-sized ledge behind a large Kohler sink. It was difficult for me to reach most of my things over the sink. More bathroom counter space would have been nice, and I would have gladly given up the tv for the space. Similarly, the shower was tiny, even for someone my size. I am under 120 pounds, but I found the shower small and confining. (I hoped I did not drop the soap because there wasn't much room to bend down and pick it up!) The water pressure was also not that good. I would have preferred using the tub (which had a hand-held shower), but there was no curtain. I would stay here again, but for the fact the bathrooms (a major concern when I stay) were not as functional as I want.

Jan 21 2007	Great Room!	Stayed at this hotel when it was the Pan Pacific. The room was luxurious for the price. Most comfortable bed I've slept in. The bathroom was all marble with a tv and bathtub. The hotel itself is on the quieter side, no nightlife in the lobby but good for a relaxing stay.

Jan 10 2007 	Great Place and Location	Having read the reviews for several major chain hotels on this website, we finally decided on JW Marriott. We were not disappointed. The location; a short block to Union Square shopping, a half block to Currant Theater and all the best resturants within easy walking distance. The buffet breakfast was simple and well done plus you can order eggs, pancakes or waffels your way, no extra charge. Service was impeccable and courteous. The Ritz is a super place to stay but its away from shopping and resturants and twice the price at best! Plus its a steep walk to Union Square and a mountain walking back for us fifty year young people. Marriott JW would be my vote if your going to the City by the Bay

Jan 4 2007 	Great location 	My wife and I stayed at the Marriott from Dec 27 - January 2. The location cannot be beat. Only one block from Union Square. We felt very comfortable and safe in this hotel.Service was excellent. Everyone welcomed us with a greeting and a smile.

Jan 2 2007 	No Problems	I stayed at this location many times when it was the Pan Pacific but this was my first visit since it has become JW Marriott. Dec 31 2006 	Good stay at the Marriott	My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pacific several years ago, before it became the JW Marriott, and we were very happy with our stay. Dec 31 2006 	JW Marriott is nice but a bit dated.	The JW was very nice as described by other reviewers. Location is excellent in Union Square-- close to the cable car at Powell St, and bus and BART lines on Market St. Overall, however, I was more impressed by my stay at the Hotel Monaco in September 2004-- (we were upgraded to a suite, so the comparison is not entirely apt) it's newer and feels more special than did the JW Marriott.

Dec 30 2006	Wonderful 10th Anniversary	My husband and I visited the J.W. Marriott November 11th-15th to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We greatly enjoyed our stay. Dec 5 2006 	JW was superb	This was the first time that my girlfriend and I stayed in SF and we were unsure as to whether to stay at Fishermans Wharf or Union Sq. Nov 8 2006 	Great Hotel in San Fran	We were impressed with the hotel's architecture. The room was standard but the bathroom was lovely. The hotel was close to shopping and restaurants. We would stay here again in San Francisco.

Oct 11 2006 	Just Average	The JW Marriott San Francisco was a bit of a disappointment given the strong reputation the property had under its previous owner, the Pan Pacific.There's nothing wrong with the hotel--its clean enough, in a good location, with a staff that tries well enough. Its hard to point the finger at any one thing, but the lobby decor and the large atrium seem a bit out of place for this kind of hotel. The rooms itself are plainly decorated. My request for a high floor with a view was NOT accomodated despite elevated Marriott status. Instead, I was given a larger room, which was indeed roomy enough. The bathroom size was a major plus, though the mirrors all over is a bit disconcerting (you don't really need to be looking at yourself doing EVERYTHING!).The bed was NOT comfortable at all. This property does not have Marriott's Revive bedding, and the mattress was stiff and firm. My back ached after one night. The location just off Union Square is very good for touring the city. Instead of the hotel restaurant, which was very expensive, we ate at Lori's Diner across the street. Actually ran into some members of the Boston Red Sox, who were staying at the nearby Westin St. Francis. The staff itself were pleasant enough, but in rather short supply. The valet service, on the other hand, is a DISASTER. Upon checking out, we had to wait at least 25 minutes for our car, and they constantly seemed overwhelmed and disorganized. At nearly $50 a night for parking, that's simply unacceptable.Overall, the next time I'm in San Francisco, I will try a different hotel. The St. Francis is literally down the street, and there are a bunch of others nearby. Its not that the JW is a bad place, its just not a particularly special one. Marriott should invest money and freshen it up if they are going to brand it a JW.

Oct 9 2006 	Great hotel in the middle of everything!	We stayed at the JW Marriot for only one night, but it was the nicest hotel on our road trip. Oct 3 2006 	Excellent stay at the JW Union Square	We stayed at the JW Marriott in downtown San Francisco for 3 nights in Sept. Oct 2 2006 	Great Weekend	Our stay was September 21-24th. We used the BART from the airport and walked about 4 blocks to the property from the Powell Street Station. The room was clean and daily maid service was excellent, though I agree with a previous post that the room itself is showing some minor signs of wear and tear (scuff marks, start of peeling wallpaper, etc); also, the mattress "pillow" seemed a bit worn and not nearly as comfortable as other Marriotts where we've stayed, but it was adequate and not important enough to report to the management. It was generally a nice experience.

The beds were extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice, although I would have forgone the large sunken tub for a roomier shower and a second sink. The tv in the bathroom was a nice touch. Our rooms were always cleaned when we returned at night and turndown service was available each night. I did call the front desk the first morning because I was having trouble with the hairdryer. Someone was at my door with a new one in just a few minutes. Although my requests were always pretty simple and mostly direction oriented, the concierge was extremely nice and always happy to help with a smile. This seemed more like a hotel suited for business travelers, but it works just fine for tourists as well. I would recommend this hotel. Aug 25 2006 	Perfect stay!	Fantastic location! I couldn't have been happier with my JW Marriott experience. Aug 13 2006	Enjoyed our stay	We decided to choose the JW Marriott based on the reviews I read in TripAdvisor. I am glad I relied on those reviews. It was a wonderful experience. Aug 7 2006 	This may be one of the better hotels in the area....	...but based on my own travel experience, I cannot give this property more than 3 stars. We arrived at 1pm to check in which was 3 hours earlier than the normal check in time but this wasn't even mentioned to us as we checked in. We did not eat in the resturant but it looked nice. We had some drinks at the bar when was very plesant. Overall I would have no hesitation in reccommending the JW Marriott in San Francisco and would stay in it again.
