Everyone from the housekeeping staff to the concierge is very helpful. The staff is always offering to help.Rooms: Again, I don't particularly care for the whole cream, brown, black decor, but the rooms are large with very comfortable beds. I will say it appears the furniture could use some changing out as the tables in our room had a multitude of scraches as did the chest outside of the bathroom.Room Service: The food was exactly as ordered and was good. Of course room service is expensive, ( Breakfast for 2 was over $40!) but it was really good.Location: Hotel is close to everything. We went to see a play at the Lorraine Hansbury Theatre and all we had to do was walk 1 block up from the hotel.....SWEET! Union Square is only 2 blocks away and Chinatown is only about 5 blocks away. You are also 1 block from the street car line that will take you down close to the Fisherman's Warf.The Bathroom: Great!!!! Towels are so nice and he products on hand are good too.Cleanliness: The entire hotel was spotless.WHAT I DISLIKED....Small LCD TVs - These TVs are too small to be in these large rooms. Although they are clear, it is still very hard to see. Doesn't matter to me if there is a TV in the bathroom or not, but the main TV should be large enough to see.Decor: Like I said earlier. I did not like the color scheme. Made the hotel too dark. Needs color. I know it's the Asian theme, but if this hotel wants to be known as the JW Marriott and not the Pan Pacific, the decor has to change.The robes: C'mon. I have never seen a JW with the waffle robes. The robes need to be the deep, plush, soft, long terry robes. These little robes barely covered me and I am not a big woman.Overall, the JW Marriott is a nice hotel and I would stay here again. Especially since I got a military rate of $130 per night which was great!.

May 20 2006 	Mediocre	Was eager to try the new San Francisco JW Marriott (formerly Pan Pacific) after great experiences at other JWs worldwide. Overall, my stay was mediocre and below expectations. WHAT I LIKED....* Very comfortable bed -- comparable to the quality and comfort of a Westin or Four Seasons bed. Blows away Marriott's standard fare, and even their new Revive bed * Excellent bathrooms -- with separate showers/baths, good lighting, and lots of amenities* Hotel car -- which was available almost every time I needed a taxi. Saved a boatload of money, though I didn't like being reminded to "take care of the driver" each time I used it* Great location -- with awesome shopping, attractions, and restaurants surrounding the hotel in every direction* Friendly staff -- all of the staff I encountered (housekeeping, front desk, bell desk, and room service) were very friendly WHAT I DISLIKED....* Construction noise - which started every morning between 6-8am. Avoid rooms facing Post or Mason Street if you enjoy sleeping. Stay instead in the back corner of the hotel, though even there you'll hear a bit of noise due to the JW's horrible windows. Annoying!* Small LCD TVs - standard rooms come a 23" Gateway LCD TV, which is ridiculously small given the size of the room and table it sits on. Can't a so-called "luxury" hotel afford 26" or 32" units?* Mediocre service - was checked into a smoking room after requesting nonsmoking. The next day while I was at work, the hotel moved me to a nonsmoking room without warning and neglected to move half of my luggage. Was locked out of my old room and had to visit front desk to figure out what happened. Good intent, but horrible execution* Dull decor -- interior atrium is a bit dark and drab. Marriott really needs to freshen up the designOverall, the JW Marriott has a ways to go before it can compete with the top hotels of San Francisco. I've recently stayed at the Omni, Fairmont, Four Seasons, and Mandarin, and prefer all of them to the JW (though admittedly the latter two are in a different league).

Apr 17 2006	Loved the Pan Pacific!	From April 8-April 12th, my fiance and I traveled to San Francisco. We stayed in the Pan Pacific hotel located near Union Square. It is absolutely perfect and we will never stay anywhere else when we visit San Francisco again. It is a bit pricey, but it is totally worth it. The concierge and valet are very friendly and will do anything for you. We lost our cell phone the first day there and they called all the airport shuttles and the airport to track the phone. Eventually our phone was returned from a cab driver and delivered to a valet at the hotel, who held on to it until we returned from dinner. Out of 21 floors, we stayed on the 20th floor. The room was large, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was amazing! In the beautiful bathroom were robes, a small television, big mirrors, a telephone, a large tub and a separate shower. We also had our own personal butler simply by pressing a button. Our butler brought us sugar and salt for our food, 10 extra hangers, extra towels, and even gave us bath beads/salts for our bath. The hotel staff members are experts on San Francisco. For every question we had, and we had a lot of them, the staff had a prompt reply. They supplied us with maps, directions, and recommendations. Even after they stopped a taxi for us, they wiped down the seats to make sure they were not wet since it had been raining a lot. Every time that we wanted to go eat the concierge recommended great places. The hotel's restaurant was great for breakfast also--even though it was a bit pricey, it was the BEST we had in San Francisco. One day we rented a car, which our hotel set up for us. The car was from Hertz, which is literally right across the street and was luxurious -a 2006 Toyota Avalon with everything. If I HAD to name two cons: flat screen tv could have had a better picture and we would have liked the hotel to have a pool (even though we had access to one with a fee).It was great, we didn't want to leave the hotel, and we loved our visit!THANKS to everyone at Pan Pacific for making our stay in San Francisco remarkable!

Apr 7 2006 	Pampered at the Pan Pacific	I thoroughly enjoyed my two-night stay at the Pan Pacific. I got a low on-line rate of $179/night, which was really a bargain for this class of hotel in this city. The lobby was very attractive, with a large, interesting sculpture, a seating area next to a modern fireplace, and a bar that looked like a good place to have a quiet drink. The restaurant looked a bit sterile. I did not eat there, so I can't comment on the food. The rooms in this modern hotel are all arranged around a central empty space so you can look down from a balcony to the lobby and watch the glass, pod-like elevators go up and down. My room looked very much like the room pictured in another traveler's candid photos and the ones on the hotel's website. The bathroom was very luxurious and attractive, with separate tub and marble shower stall. The hairdryer was not the usual one that makes some people want to bring their own anyway. It was the turbo type. There was no jacuzzi or shower massage, as some luxury hotels may have. The complimentary toiletries were very nice and included a shampoo/conditioner, shower gel, and lotion. My room was not on the street, had a view of the rooms of another hotel (not close though), and was very quiet. The room was an off-white color with attractive art. The turn-down service included chocolates, an ice-filled ice bucket, the laying out of the robe(s)on the bed, and the turning on of soft jazz on the radio -- very nice to come home to. A complimentary "USA Today" was delivered in the morning. The mattress was an inner-spring type covered with a filled-type mattress topper. The sheets smelled really fresh, and there were lots of comfy, large pillows. The furniture was nice, but the pieces had sustained some nicking -- perhaps from luggage or vacuuming. The carpet was very handsome. The desk chair was an ergonomic type. The room was separated from the bathroom by the closet and a small hallway. I agree with the other traveler about the in-room coffee. In-room coffee is always bad, but I thought that maybe in such a nice hotel they would have figured out a way to make it drinkable. Also, there should be real cups, not paper. I would recommend this hotel for a romantic get-away -- especially if you can get a good, on-line deal. The location is fantastic.

Feb 11 2006 	A Welcome Suprise!	A usual guest of the Ritz Carlton and the Fairmont, I chose the Pan Pacific this time as I was spending the weekend and wanted to be near Union Square. The rate was excellent so I decided to try it..What a wonderful surprise! The location is superb, the room I had was huge and very well laid out. The service was excellent and unobtrusive. I was there mostly for business and unlike a previous reviewer, I had no problem with internet access and again ,the layout of the room was such that I felt very comfortable working. The ability to walk everywhere is a huge draw and the staff was always friendly and helpful. Some soft good room renovations may be in order but mostly, no problem. I agree mini-bar selections should be upgraded as well as brighter bathroom lighting -room service offerings could also be greater for those of us "chained to the computer." I will definitely stay at the Pan Pacific again, and look forward to it!

Feb 6 2006	Excellent -- quiet clean and friendly	Stayed at this hotel for just one night. Checkin was very quick and they gave us an upgraded room, which we were told meant "a bigger bathroom". The hotel is not the newest but it is classy and once inside the room it feels very private because it is nice and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable.Upon exiting the hotel to go out for dinner we told the bellboy we needed a taxi and he offered us the hotel towncar -- free of service, "just tip the driver". A nice touch.All in all a positive 4* experience in a good location in San Francisco and would definitely stay again.

Feb 2 2006 	Great location	We spent a long weekend at the Pan Pacific for business. This is the 2nd time we stayed at this location (the first time primarily because of a deal I found on travelzoo). Out of all the hotels we've visited in SF, this is one of our favorites, because:1) location -- it's less than one block from Union Square, close enough to pop into Saks but far enough that you don't walk out right into all the tourist crowds. 2) service -- is amazing. From the men who valet park ($40/d for in and out privilege, which is competetive if not reasonable for the area), to the concierge, to the room service, everyone is there to please. I was always greeted by name when I called anywhere in the botel. The server in the restaurant remembered what we liked for breakfast. We had a problem with our room safe and the service tech was there in 5 minutes. 3) clean -- room and bathroom. Little touches like crown molding on the ceiling add a nice touch.4) price -- much more affordable than Four Seasons or even the Westin, and I don't feel like I'm missing anything. Even the minibar is affordable.The cons:1) There is no storage space in the rooms. One little bureau is all. 2) For business travelers, there's nowhere in the hotel to really eat well, but some of the best restaurants in SF are a block away. Also, the charge for internet and printer use is high.

Jan 26 2006	2nd Time Was A Charm	We stayed here last July (see my review) and had a horrible experience. After we got home, I went to the hotel's website and much to my surprise, it listed the managers for each department and included their contact information. I contacted the Director of Room Operations and explained our experience (via email). Our hats off to Jim Bolinger (the Director of Room Operations) for his quick follow-up and sincere concern about our experience. He replied to our email within a day, apologizing profusely for our experience and offered us a gift certificate for a free night's stay. This is the type of service that is lacking with so many other establishments. For most hotels, you are lucky if you get a general information phone number that sends you to a corporate call center, but with this hotel, contact information for each manager is listed right on the hotel's website.During our return visit, check-in was flawless and the reception person was quite friendly. Our room was spotless and extremely comfortable (though I'm still not sure what people need with such a large room when they are on vacation in a big city, but in any event). The horror of our previous stay was erased and we had a restful night's sleep.The Concierge offered us a spot on suggestion for a place to hear live Blues music. He sent us to Biscuits and Blues, about a block and a half away. The music was great and the food was delicious! The Concierge's recommendation for breakfast the following morning was just as good.I'm glad we went back to give Pan Pacific another try. We were delighted by our experience and plan to make this our hotel of choice for those quick "big city" getaways.

Jan 24 2006	Check it out!	My husband and I are from Boston and travel quite extensively. We went to San Francisco on Christmas to spend some time with our daughter. We ended up staying a month. I've always wanted to stay at the Pan Pacific, but didn't really want to spend that much money, especially for an extended stay. I just called up the reservations manager and asked for some cosideration based on the length of our stay and payment up front. She was very accomodating. We Loved it there! We have stayed in many hotels in San Francisco (from budget to boutique to fancy) and this was worth every cent and more. They went out of thier way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The Bellmen were super courteous and helpful, the concierge couldn't do enough,Michelle the Bar girl was great and most of all, Christine, THANK YOU. We now have a home away from home. The rooms are a good size, beds-super plush and comfy, bathrooms are large, marbled, and some have TV'S. Even at regular price, you get what you pay for and we got a lot more than expected. I would suggest the Pan Pacific anytime!

Jan 19 2006 	Nice but not for business travelers	I stayed in this hotel for 10 days on business, and overall it was very nice. I had an AMAZING view of the city that was especially gorgeous at night. However, the construction on the roof of the building next door did tend to detract from it - not to mention that it woke me up bright and early despite my late work hours.The problem was that we were under the impression that it was a business-oriented hotel. Not so. My assistant had computer problems, and it was a whopping 49 cents a minute just to use the business center. Even with a decent budget, that was way beyond any reasonable range and it left us stuck until we could get him a new computer.Internet access is expensive, and wireless is not available in the rooms. You're chained to the desk. Also, even if you've paid your $10/day for in-room access, you still have to pay an additional $10 per day if you want to use the wireless in the lobby. Parking is a budget-breaker at $42 plus tax per day, but we expected that. What we didn't expect was how long it would take to get our car. Even when we called down, it was often 20-30 minutes. Once, they lost our car which made us late for an important meeting. Finally, the in-room coffee is terrible and you only get two packets. Luckily, there's a great little coffeehouse a few doors down. Don't count on having a late-night caffeine kick available as you're working on that presentation. The honor bar choices are awful too, nothing healthy in there and nowhere to get quick munchies.This would be a nice place to stay for fun, but if you expect any basic business amenities, don't let the comfy office chairs they advertise fool you. You'll work more efficiently at any basic Courtyard.

Jan 10 2006	Very Very Good Value!	We are just back from the Pan Pacific in San Francisco and it is pretty hard not to like. Here is a quick review: Location: Excellent - not on Union Square - but only one block away and handy to everything downtown. Room: Furnishings are of an excellent quality - Excellent bedding (new and well laundered) - Upgraded Mattress - extra long tub - bathroom exceeded expectations - Room came with two robes rather than the more standard 1.Butler service - didnt use it.Car service - was excellent - used it 4 times for dinner transportation - everyone was polite and I didnt receive any resistance when asking to use it.Concierge: was excellent. Very good dinner recommendations within my price range / service expectations and cuisine preferences. They were also able to get me very short notice reservations at Garry Danko (a AAA 5 diamond restaurant).Front Desk - polite and efficientMaid service - unobtrusive and efficientValue - $200+ a night service levels at a $150 a night rate.Noise - San Francisco can be fairly loud - a la Manhattan. I had a 15th floor room and it was very very quite.Final thought - Pan Pacific is not the most attractive of hotels from an architectural standpoint. However the rooms are impeccably clean; excellently furnished and the staff are very competent. It is a quite and very reasonably priced.Food recommendations:Garry Danko - 5 star cuisine in the $200+ range for 2Rue Lepic - near Pan Pacific - French home style cooking - standard Bistro fare - $70 for 2Afternoon Tea - Neiman Marcus Rotunda Room - $50 for 2.Breakfast - Sears Fine Foods Union Square - excellent portions - really well prepared - good menu - two blocks from Pan Pacific.

Jan 4 2006	Fantastic Hotel	We recently chose the Pan Pacific as our destination for two nights of celebrating our anniversary. After extensive research of the area and the many hotel choices, we chose the Pan Pacific after receiving a great deal on the internet. We were pleasantly surprised and extremely happy with our choice. We were upgraded to a higher floor after explaining that it was our anniversary. We were welcomed to a large room with extensive views of the city, along with a complimentary plate of fruit, cheeses, and crackers. The room was spotless and the bathroom was beautifully decorated with marble, mirrors, and even a television to watch while soaking in the tub! Each time we returned to the hotel from a walk, we were greeted with "Welcome back" and each morning we were greeted with "Good morning" and smiling faces. The staff (especially at the guest registration desk and the doormen) were so great to us, the doorman even remembered our name. They also provide complimentary car service (during certain hours), and the driver was great recommending restaurants for us. For those that like to work off the excess calories they have ingested while on vacation, the hotel has a very nice gym with 3 televisions, water, and complimentary fruit to snack on. Overall, this was a great stay at the Pan Pacific and we will definitely make it our hotel of choice from now on when visiting the city.

Dec 29 2005	mixed feeling	My husband and I just got back from San Francisco. We stayed here for 2 nights. I had a high expectation of the hotel since my family and I had stayed many many times at Pan Pacific around the world and had always experienced a first class service. Goods:- We were assigned a room for disable, therefore, there was only a shower and no tub as promised. We asked to be reassigned and the nice man who checked us in previously was able to reassign us another room with a tub. He was very friendly and accomodating. - The room was nice.. very spacious. Liked the design. - The bed was comfortable. Lots of extra fluffy pillows. - A perfect location. One block from Union Square. Close enough to walk to the shopping area, but not smacked in the middle of the crowd. - Loved the big bathroom. A small TV in the bathroom was a nice touch. Loved taking a bath and watching my favorite sitcom at the same time. The bads:- The "doormen" were unfriendly. Not even once they ever said hello or smiled at us when we walked by. In fact, one time my husband said hello and was ignored even though he clearly was looking at us. - Another bad experience with the unfriendly "doormen." We were told the hotel provided a car service. We asked a doorman if the car would take us to Japantown. He started laughing and condesendingly said, "That's 15 blocks from here." A simple "no" would do. - During check in, the nice man I mentioned above mentioned I should take advantage of the butler drawing bath for guests. It sounded nice, so I thought, why not. So, when we got to the room, we requested the buttler to draw me a bath. First of all, the butler lady was so puzzled when we requested it (I checked, it was listed as one of the services they provided guests). When she came to our room, she asked me if I would do it myself. She gave me a bowl of bath salt and left. I didn't mind doing that myself, but you cannot advertise your service and not deliver. At the end, I could only rate this hotel 3 out of 5. Maybe what their employees need is a class on "Customer Service."

Dec 28 2005	One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had!	We had the pleasure of staying at the Pan Pacific in San Francisco for three nights, including Christmas Eve and Christmas day. Prior to arrival, I had already called two times to confirm what type of room we'd be having and that we would be arriving late at night. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a Jr. Suite (King bed, pull out sofa, huge bathroom), as all the double rooms were full. The person at the front desk was extremely helpful and pleasant and gave us a call about 30 minutes late to make sure that everything in our room was okay. The room was quite large, was a corner and had large windows on both sides. We were on the 11th floor, so the views weren't spectacular, but you could see a bit of Union Square and the hustle and bustle of the San Francisco Streets.During our stay we sought the services of the concierge a couple of different times, and were always met with prompt and friendly service, including helping us to find places that were open around the city on Christmas day. He also helped us to check-in for our flight and print boarding passes. All employees of the hotel that we encountered were extremely helpful, friendly and polite. Room service food was quite good, prompt and abundant for a reasonable rate (for room service). The bed was extremely comfortable. We were able to check out as late at 2 p.m. on our departure day.Overall, a great hotel experience!

Dec 22 2005 	Big rooms ambivalent service poor plasma TVs	Two-night stay in early December 2005. Service levels, unfortunately, depend greatly on the individual employee you encounter. I was checked into a standard room with a non-working TV and two double beds (I'm 6-4.) When I returned to the desk at 11:35 PM, with all my luggage in tow, I said, "We'll have to try again - the tv won't turn on with either the remote or the button on the TV." Without looking up or giving me any eye contact, the clerk said "We'll have engineering go up in a bit." This is at 11:35 PM. Not the answer I expected or was looking for; certainly no apology or empathy. So, I escalated with "Well, given that I'm 6-4, I'd prefer a king bed anyway, so let's go ahead and try another room." The clerk's response: "We don't have any king rooms left." Said in a flat tone of voice, still without eye contact. Lucky for me, the clerk who had originally checked me in (with good hospitality) came out at that moment and recovered nicely for the other clerk, immediately placing me in what PP calls a "junior suite" but what is actually a larger corner room with a king bed.If this Pan Pacific property reminds you of a Hyatt, with its vertical interior atrium room arrangement, it's because it's a Portman pre-Hyatt design. Lots of thick walls, thick marble, thick circles. The rooms themselves are large and reasonable, but dated. Bathrooms are generous but very "Family Affair/Buffy/Jody" in their decor - too much almond/beige, including all fixtures. The TVs in the rooms are far too small and, with only standard-definition signals coming in, the result is a too-soft, smeared picture.This is not a hotel to stay in for any views of the city.Additional snarky service was experienced at the hotel bar and by the concierge. My colleague asked the concierge if he had any tape to secure a box. Without looking up, the employee rummaged in a drawer, produced a roll of plastic tape, placed it on the counter, and went back to their paperwork. For this class of hotel, one expects at least "Certainly sir, here you go;" "Would you like me to secure that? Do you need it sent anywhere?" was evidently beyond the comprehension of the employee.

Dec 18 2005	Great find	We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 5 nights from Thanksgiving after researching on tripadvisor. We got a great deal for a superior room on Expedia.It's a great hotel and the room was lovely and big. The location was fabulous, a 2 minute walk to Union square and all the hustle and bustle of downtown. The concierge was fantastic and secured us a table at a wonderful restaurant for a celebration.I think that this hotel should be higher in the ratings, it is excellent value for money.

Dec 5 2005	Excellent	Another great choice based on TA reviews.The location--Union Square--is ideal. Walk to Chinatown, BART, cable car (if you must), shopping, SOMA, restaurants. The area just to the west is a bit seedy at nite, but in perspective downtown SF is the safest-seeming big city I've been to in the US. Hotel also has a complimentary town car--they took me to the CalTran station--have no idea how much further you can push it.From the outside nothing special but the upper lobby (base of the atrium) has some sort of impressive modernist sculpture and a nice (but pricey) bar. Plenty of Irish pubs in the area too. Notice one reviewer panned the restaurant. Served him right. Within a few blocks is a great Indonesian place, a Morton's, a wonderful taqueria, and the best Chinese outside China. Anyone who travels a bit can attest: ONLY LOSERS EAT IN THEIR HOTEL! The room was clean, bright, large enough, with a large immaculate marble bathroom with separate shower and bath. Service was efficient, though they were mysteriously stingy replenishing the soap. PP is really a first-rate business hotel that works great for vacations, though nothing particularly charming, romantic or historic about it. If you're in SF on business you can probably find something closer to the financial district/Embarcadero but at the cost of things to do at nite. Highly recommended.

Dec 2 2005	Absolutely loved this hotel	Stayed in Pan Pacific for 4 nights, had an amazing time. Arrived to the hotel around 2am after a long flight from New York with a small child, manager at the desk was very friendly, we got upgraded to a suite even though we only paid for a double room. Once we got to the room we noticed that there was one king size bed, we called the desk right away and they brought a roll-away bed for our son, only took them 5 minutes. We had a great stay, staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable. We did think about having lunch at the hotel restaurant but the menu wasn't very good and a bit pricey. There are plenty of good restaurants around, check out The Cheesecake Factory nearby (in Macy's). I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again next time i'm in San Francisco.

Dec 2 2005	Peachy Pan Pacific	We had a wonderful two night stay at the Pan Pacific. My wife uses her wheelchair in our room, and the room we booked was not a traditional accessible-type, so when I called to make the reservation, the concierge had maintainence go up and measure the bathroom door opening to make sure it would work for her.This is the kind of service that made our stay so enjoyable. Our room on the 18th floor was spacious, clean, and night-time quiet despite only being a block from Union Square.Kudos to the Pan Pacific. We will be back. Jim Myers

Nov 30 2005	dined at restaurant	we had dinner at their restaurant and the food wassimply awful! (regular food-japanese style)Informed the head waiter that we were very disappointed with the food. all they could say wasthat they were sorry.when I got back home I sent a letter to The Pan Pacific Hotel in San Francisco. a letter to the Customer Relations one to the Hotel Management  and one to the Restaurant Manager  So far I have't heard from them.

Nov 28 2005	A great hotel in a great location	We stayed at the Pan Pacific for four nights the weekend prior to Thanksgiving. We stayed in a Superior room. The Superior room is very comfortable and spacious enough to keep you from feeling claustrophobic. There is a loveseat and side chair in addition to the desk area which is great, especially for just relaxing at the end of the day prior to going to bed.The bathrooms were very clean and modern. We booked the room through Expedia and had no problems at all during our entire stay. We booked a Deluxe room from one night for a visiting friend who lived outside the city, and though the room is noticeably smaller than the Superior room we had, (there is no couch and side chair in a Deluxe room), it was very nice, and again had a very clean and spacious bathroom.I would recommend the Pan Pacific to anyone traveling to the San Francisco area.

Nov 28 2005	Great stay a the Pan Pacific	My partner and I just returned from a 4-night stay just prior to Thanksgiving and overall, we really enjoyed our stay. Although we had standing reservations at the Prescott across the street (I stayed there years ago and loved it) we decided to give the Pan Pacific a try after seeing a special web promotion offering a superior king room for just $129/nt + tx. We were not disappointed!First, the Pan's location is excellent. It's a stone's throw from Union Square, but situated just far enough from all of the square's traffic noise and crowded sidewalks. It's also a short walk to Market St., Chinatown and North Beach making it a great base of operations for a SF vacation (and for people who love to see a town on foot!)Our 8th floor room had a decent view of the Mason & Post intersection and it was comfortable and well appointed. Features included an exceptionally large bathroom, separate dressing area, and a tastefully decorated bedroom. We enjoyed the three phones and the Herman Miller desk chair, but best of all was the room's ultra-comfy pillow-top bed. I'd put it right up there with the "heavenly beds" featured at some of the Pan's competitors (e.g. Starwood properties like W or Westin). I slept really, really well on this trip (not often the case for me) and I have to give lots of credit to the bed! From the front desk, to the bell hops, to the personal butler service available on all floors, the service was consistently professional, warm and friendly. Speaking of the butler service, the butlers we encountered were prompt, friendly and gracious. While this service is a unique and welcome feature at this hotel, we were a little surprised to learn that it's also the ONLY way to obtain ice for your room. It would be nice to also offer guests the do-it-yourself option for ice, rather than summoning the help each time. Between ringing for the butler, waiting for a phone call back for clarification, followed by waiting for the doorbell or knock, and then the awkwardness of whether to tip each time...well... it just seemed like a few too many hoops to jump through (and a few too many minutes to wait) just for a simple bucket of ice. I have to clarify that this is not so much a complaint, as it is an observation/ suggestion. Please - don't let our little ice delivery issue keep you from checking out this fine hotel...In summary, the Pan Pacific's prime location, friendly staff, tasteful room design (well-represented on their web site) and some VERY comfy beds all added up to a great stay. We'd gladly return!

Nov 21 2005	Pan Pacific San Francisco stay in early-November 2005	My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our recent visit to San Francisco. We had no idea what to expect but were tremendously pleased with our decision after. Here's our main reasons why:Location: excellent. Literally a couple of minutes walk from Union Square and all the wonderful shopping possibilities there (e.g. Macys, Neiman Marcus, Saks, etc). Also close to the public transport stops, for both trams and sub-way stops. We walked everywhere: Fisherman's Wharf, Market Street, Embarcadero, North Beach..etc. Food: Zagat-rated restaurant in-house. Expensive but delicious. We paid around USD 35, for a Caesar Salad and 2 hot chocolates.Service: Very friendly and non-intrusive. Room comfort: our superior-room was spacious and clean with a very comfortable king-sized bed. We got a deal through their Internet site for USD 153 per night incl. of taxes.Fitness room: range of fitness equipment available (cross-trainer, treadmill, bikes, weights, machines) 24-hours.

Nov 6 2005	Large Room	We booked this room through Expedia $194 per night. We stayed 2 nights. The parking was too expensive so we caught a ride into the city and caught the Bart out of the city. The Bart was very convenient so long as your luggage isn't too large and heavy. The room was very large it had 2 closets, robes, desk with an ergonomic chair which was great, LCD television screen, Bose radio, couch, coffee maker, king sized bed, our bathroom did not have a lot of counter space with a pedestal sink, Gilchrist and Soames toiletries, hair dryer, no tub, just a shower stall with some mold visible if you look good. We were in a corner room so it was very quiet. There was a butler button if you needed one, the staff seemed nice and helpful. There was also a safe which they state can fit your computer. we thought the location was great! The hotel was close to union square, market street, and shopping. I probably would stay here again but would want to pay less.

Oct 24 2005	Disappointing	Really has gone downhill since our last visit a few years ago. Seems like the magic disappeared. Room was OK eventhough we tried pretty hard to get a good view- but that didn't happen. Hall carpets were wet as they were being washed on our floor- so much for the ambience. Parking is such a rip off. Concierge does not match the level of the others at similiar hotels. Will probably spend a little more and stay elsewhere next time around.

Oct 21 2005 	very good	no major complaints. the room was very large and clean, and well appointed. minor beef with the color scheme in the bathroom- some kind of ugly peachy/cream color. should have gone with basic white. nice stall shower as well as bathtub. very good water pressure, plush plenitful towels, and the nicest robe anywhere.decent city view. nice LCD tv, albeit a little small. (must have acquired them before the bottom fell out on flat panel prices).very nice workout area with all new equipment.the staff was decent enough, with and occasionally indifferent doorman. the butler concept i didnt quite get, nor did i see him, but whatever, im sure he worked for me.even though it was only a few blocks from union square, for some reason it still felt a bit removed from it all. perhaps because that particular neighborhood was a bit shabby.overall an excellent hotel, professionally run. a decent choice.

Oct 14 2005	Great location in San Francisco	We were very impressed with the Pan Pacific. Great location, close to transport, shopping and good restaurants. A huge hotel but didn't feel impersonal, service was swift and friendly at all times. We got a good deal through Expedia and felt is was great value for money - would definitely go back there when visiting San Francisco again.PS: though I've heard much mention of the 'construction' we did not see or hear it.

Oct 5 2005	Very nice	Very nice experience at this hotel. Booked on line thru a discounter so was not dissapointed with lack of a view.. with the price we paid it was worth it!Only one gripe was having to pay close to $8 to print out my plane boarding passes thru their business center. Felt it should be a free feature at a hotel of this class. But I highly recommend the hotel for its location, amenities and luxury (Bathroom was incredible)!!

Sep 23 2005	You get your own butler regardless of room choice!!!	We were warmly welcomed, check in really fast and given a guided tour of our room. A huge room I must add and it was the cheapest one on the net $170. Big cosy bed, flatscreen TV, Bose radio, TV in the bathroom whilst you soak in the bath, HUGE vanity area, seperate shower with great water pressure, bathroom scales so you can see how many pounds you have gained on your trip!! and last but not least EVERY room has a button where you can call your personal butler for your every whim. I have to say I did not use it once as everything is already provided for you.Right on union square, a 5 min walk from BART/MUNI, right on a trolley car line, a courtesy house car to take you to wherever you wish in downtown....... An excellent hotel.Also 3 minutes walk at 643 Post St there is a GREAT Thai Restaurant called Ar Roi. Give Mortons Steakhouse in the other direction a miss though.

Sep 21 2005	Impressed	Is there really such a thing as a "perfect" stay? Perhaps this deserves a 5-circle rating. It probably would have gotten it if not for a couple of drawbacks. I stayed at the Pan Pacific on 9-16-05. One drawback was the fact that it was a little pricey @ $250 for a one-night stay in a Deluxe King through hotels--which was the cheapest rate available. I've seen other reviews that talked about the radio alarm going off unexpectedly. Yes, that happened to us also at 6:15 a.m. When I first arrived at check-in, there was only one person at the desk initially. The man--an early 30ish male, stocky build, with a receding hairline, dirty blondish hair and LONG bangs combed backwards--was helping another couple which was fine. But he clearly saw me, as well as another couple behind me, yet continued to carry on a very LONG and UNNECESSARY casual conversation with the couple. Needless to say I thought this was extremely inconsiderate. He could've at least taken a second just to ACKNOWLEDGE we were there. Eventually another woman came to the desk who was very accomodating. It took her forever to authorize my credit card but that was due to the glitches in her computer equipment. She was very fast, friendly, and thorough. Onto the room...Very spacious for a couple...Everything was spotless...The marble bathroom was immaculate...The shower was a little on the small side, especially if you plan on "sharing" it with another person (LoL), but was still nice. The flatscreen TV was great with a large array of channels should you actually take time to watch it. Room service was swift and the food was good. Valet service brought us a bucket of ice to our room quickly. There was no view, but I never requested one. All in all, it was an impressive hotel and I would definitely stay there again. Just remember to request a room with a view if it's important to you, and UNPLUG THE CLOCK RADIO AS SOON AS YOU STEP IN THE ROOM IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE AWAKENED!!! ;]

Sep 20 2005	Excellent choice for the picky traveler	My partner and I stayed in this hotel and was impressed from the beginning. The staff are helpful and polite while the accommodations are attractive and tasteful. Our room did not feel too small and the all marble bathroom is impressive. A free in-room safe, coffee maker, mini-bar, advanced television system and a BOSE radio made the room a very nice place to stay. Add to that the location is ideal for nightlife, theatre, shopping or exploring Chinatown. We lucked out and the big gay dance club was only a few blocks away! We felt very safe walking at night around the hotel and taxis are plentiful. There was construction on our side of the hotel but they were nowhere in sight during the weekend and not all that loud on the weekday. The tubed elevators are very Shagadelic!All in all - a place I would return to again and recommend to friends.

Sep 16 2005 	Consistently great	Stay here around once a year and hotel always remembers preferences (NY Times, high floor etc) without being reminded. Great new beds, superb service, great value for San Francisco.

Sep 14 2005	Pan Pacific Hits the Spot	We spent three days at the Pan Pacific over the Labour Day weekend. The person on the front desk was friendly and professional and swiftly checked us in. Our room was beautiful (superior king). It was a large room with a fresh contemporary design. The bathroom was luxurious - a sunken bath, a shower with good pressure (a must!), large sink with a large well lit mirror; and the toilet was discretely tucked behind a dividing wall.Other reviewers have expressed concern about the noise so I felt I should comment on this. Our room looked onto a side street and although there was some noise, I only noticed this on the first night - for me it was just a case of adjusting to the city. Daytime concierge was very friendly and helpful - although we were given misinformation in terms of the nearest MUNI stop.A word on room service - in the morning the service was excellent - be aware that there is a wider room service menu than the room card would suggest - I made the mistake of thinking the breakfast choices were very limited and later discovered that there were more choices in the hotel welcome book! Regardless, the service was efficient and friendly. However, the same cannot be said for evening room service. We called down for room service at about 10:30pm and received no response; concierge picked up the phone and he said he would call us back, but no return call was made! This was a real disappointment as this did not reflect the usual efficient service. Breakfast was a bit pricey (normal 4* prices really) but delicious. I had brioche french toast with maple syrup and pear and my partner had a cooked breakfast. I don't go for cooked breakfasts because I find them too greasy/heavy, but his looked really good. Also their double lattes are the best! I chose the Pan Pacific based on reviews I had read on TripAdviser, it lived up to my expectations and more and I would definitely stay there again if I were to visit SF in the future.

Sep 14 2005	Great hotel great location great staff....	We really enjoyed our stay at the Pan Pacific. We moved here from another SF hotel (The Marriott Fisherman's Wharf), which really wasn't for us. The Pan Pacific hit the mark. We booked a rate of $170/night from the hotel wesbite, which we felt was excellent value. Our experience of the staff was superb. The front desk were really nice and happily accomodated our request for a room on a high floot - we ended up right at the top with a superb view of the city! We found the concierge helpful and effcient, and the doorman was also a real credit to them. The room was comfortable, with a fantastic bathroom, and we really liked the curved window. A couple of issues were that we also experienced an alarm going off at what seemed like the middle of the night!! Also we heard all sorts of banging around in the conference rooms above us quite late at night, which we thought ma have been them fixing something as it only lasted about 10 minutes. All in all though, we had a great stay at the Pan Pacific and would definately stay there again.

Sep 12 2005	Very Satisfied	Arriving after a very long day of flight and drive, we were pleased to find very attentive and pleasant staff to handle the vehicle and assist with luggage.Check in was without hastle and our front desk staff moved efficiently to complete checkin and send us on to our room.As you might read elsewhere, the rooms were very nicely appointed, the dual TV's a good touch (sleeping and bath area), robes and a safe are always appreciated as well.The bed itself was quite comfortable and the room, as well as the hotel facility,clean and very presentable. I would add a special kudo to the hosekeeping staff for doing a very fine job.Despite the early start for any city in the morning, we did not notice any unexpected or overly loud noise problems, especially being in the heart of the city.We would definitely return. The Pan is centrally located, close to shopping and eateries of all kinds and one feels secure within the property. Give it a try!

Sep 9 2005	Good Location Decent hotel	We stayed at the Pan Pacific hotel in SF for three nights over the Labor Day weekend. First, the good: It is a clean hotel in a good location close to Union Square. The room was clean and the bathroom was particularly nice. I liked the gym- while not large, it had everything you need and the equipment looked new. Now, the not so good. We arrived and the gentleman at the front desk was not a gentleman. He seemed clueless when we informed him that we were expecting a bag from the airline who had lost our luggage. Then, he disputed our room rate. Basically, it was $170 for the first two nights and $150 for the third - booked through the hotel's web site. I asked for the manager who appeared - and was a bit nicer - but required that I pull up the reservation from my email and print out the confirmation. This, to me, is a bit much, particularly since I provided to them my confirmation number for the reservation. All in all, I find this extremely time consuming after a long trip. The manager did provide fruit and an apologetic note in our room for the next two nights. Further, the room was a bit loud from outside noise throughout the night. It did not bother me because I live in the city, but I could see it bothering others. My husband also complained that he could hear noice from other rooms. What's more, my husband said that the alarm clock in our room went off the first morning at 4:30 am (which we did not set.). Fortunately, I did not wake up!! Lastly, I saw virtually no hotel personnel throughout our stay, which seemed odd for a four star hotel. Perhaps, it may be because the lobby was on the third floor.

Sep 3 2005	A great value in a prime location	We were staying at the Pan Pacific for our anniversary and booked our trip through priceline. According to the Pan Pacific's rates, the cheapest room in the place is $340 per night, but we found a great all-inclusive deal that averaged out to about $100 per night. The service was above average, but not as excellent as all of the reviews that I had read. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially at the concierge desk. After a long travel day, our room wasn't ready when we arrived, and it took a little prompting on my part to speed up the process - which I shouldn't have to do. Everything else was extremely positive after that, though. The concierge was very helpful in booking us a rental car. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. It's not a huge room, but we weren't in our room very often anyways. Another note about the room - the street noise is pretty loud at times; I woke to the sounds of bottles being dumped into a bin from the lounge across the street and the ambulance/police sirens a few times as the windows are single-paned and don't keep out sound very well. The workout room on the 5th floor was nice, and it seemed to be getting regular use from the hotel guests. It was maintained very well. We didn't eat at the restaurant, and it didn't look as though it received a lot of business. The menu looked great, but was pricey. Housecleaning was fantastic! They really did a nice job each day on our room. The Pan Pacific is convenient for getting on the bus line and trolley lines. Most lines were 1-3 blocks away. Finally, I liked the 3rd floor lobby. It was a good choice for placing the lobby, as we didn't have to walk through crowds to get to our room. We could just bypass all of that with the elevator. By the way - the glass elevators are a nice touch! We will definitely stay at the Pan Pacific again. We encountered many other tourists at different SF sights asking us where we were staying, and they said that we were lucky to be there because of the reputation of the place. Plus, many others weren't enamored with their accomodations. That felt good to know that on our first trip, we hit it on the mark with our hotel choice!

Aug 29 2005	Pan Pacific was great!	As a family of 4, we all loved the Pan Pacific. The kids really thought it was great to have a TV in the bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and the room was nicely decorated. The hotel was very clean. Some others have complained about construction noise but we didn't hear any noise during our 2 night stay and never saw any construction around the hotel. Staff was very nice. We were allowed early check-in without any hassle. We would definitely stay again and recommend it to others.

Aug 25 2005	This is how you define service	We arrived from Hawaii before 6 am having booked 2 rooms near each other for our family (husband, me and 2 teenage boys). I had advised them when I booked that we were coming in early and they said they would see what they could. As it was so early I didn't expect anyone would have checked out and was dreading facing several sleep-deprived hours somewhere before we could get a room.The manager immediately started looking for available rooms as ours were not ready. He located two, but on different floors; we wanted them on the same floor at minimum. He found one available for us and another that would open up later in the day. Within 15 minutes of our arrival, we were in the room (our bags having been delivered without having to do anything), resting and so relieved to have a place to stay before exploring SF.What really impressed me was that I never heard "well, it IS hours before normal checkout" or "Not sure we can find something". In fact, they didn't even treat it as a problem as has been my experience at other hotels. They were just delighted to help us and did so in a very pleasant and efficient manner.Beyond that it is a lovely hotel in great location for a reasonable rate for SF. The concierge found us a reservation at a nearby restaurant that evening on very short notice. I had not even heard of Pan Pacific hotels before I started looking for SF hotels and felt I was taking a bit of a chance. Now I would stay at a Pan Pacific with no hesitation if they are all like the one in San Francisco.

Aug 22 2005	very satisfied with the pan pacific	just had a really pleasant three-night stay at the "pan pac" utilizing the amex special. (50% off rack rate and third night free) thanks to the reviewers below who posted about it!pros-concierge printed a boarding pass for me, and reserved separate shuttles for my mom and me-free newspaper delivered to our door-pretty cool technology: flat screen tv, bose wave radio, tv in bathroom. looks like they're working to make all the rooms wi-fi. i didn't bring a laptop, so wasn't able to test it out-central location-it was a bit chilly outside, but the room always seemed to be the perfect temperaturecons-a bit noisy (slight construction noise, and a few sirens)-view from east side of building faces a dental building-only one robe in the room for two guests, but not really a problem. i called to request another robe, and it was delivered to our room in five minutes

Aug 18 2005	Just wonderful	A great place to stay, well located and the staff was very helpful! We never got lost because of them. The rooms are wonderful, clean and have everything you need and if you are missing something just call the butler... windows are a little thin...so outside noise might be a factor

Aug 16 2005	Very Good! Great Service and Location.	Very well run 4 star hotel. Good service, unbeatable Union Sq location. The rooms are nicely furnished with marble bathrooms, very comfortable bedding and butler service on request for all rooms. We had a good breakfast at the Pacific restaurant. It is not your only choice however as there are many restaurants within a block or 2. The door man found us a nice town car limo to the airport for only $44, same price as a cab. Highly recommended hotel.

Aug 15 2005	Enjoyed the room and especailly the location	We booked through Expedia at $180. I think it was a good value for the city location, one block from Union Square and cablecar stop, two blocks from Chinatown. Sears is the traditional, nostalgic place for breakfast (Swedish pancakes, 1.5 blocks away, line moves quickly). Bathroom was best feature of room with marble, TV, separate tub and shower. Beds were quite comfortable, coffeepot is single serve though. Views were not awesome (we saw a dentist at work in a nearby building), but we didn't spend time in room much (too much to do in the city). Macy's, Tiffany's, Neiman-Marcus, Saks are nearby for shoppers.High-speed internet is not free. Dining is expensive (as expected), but many restaurants nearby. We read other reviews enough to know to walk 1-2 blocks for $28 parking garage (instead of valet almost twice that). We didn't take advantage of an luxury elements of the hotel (young family). Service was good (able to change rooms when crying baby was nextdoor).All-in-all we selected a very good place with a hotel great chain. We would probably stay again.

Aug 11 2005	Loved our stay	We arrived in San Francisco late so we just booked a room at the airport for one night and head into the city the next morning. The Clarion Hotel at the airport was absolutely aweful! I would say if rated lower than a "terrible". Hotel was dirty, room was small, smelled like smoke although we asked for a non-smoking room.,So it was a wonderful experience going to the Pan Pacific and being greeted by the valet. The concierge service was so helpful in getting a rental car and the room was fantastic. Breakfast was overpriced but what do you expect for a 4 star hotel.... Everything is always expensive. Enjoyed the down comforter in our room and the LCD. The location to Union square was great too. It was only 1 and 1/2 blocks away. We spent 2 days shopping and had a great time. Will definitely stay at the Pan Pacific next time we return to San Francisco.
